title: How to prove soul never dies - Quora

response.answer_text: This question leads to a kind of Unified Theory of Human Eternal Life. It’s a great question to consider. That’s because this is one of the most important things being offered to everyone all the time. In other words, your “soul”, All That Is and the Universe want you to know that you’re eternal. It also wants you to know that you are creating your reality as you live your life. Only then can you live your life the way you intended. It’s important to know when looking for proof that you’re not going to find any objective evidence that the soul never dies. That’s because life experience (even “after-life” experience) is 100 percent subjective. The only way to “prove” it is to prove it to yourself, in your own life experience. It is literally impossible to prove it definitively to others with any kind of objective evidence because all the evidence is first-person experiential. Physical life experience…particularly the external seeming, objective aspects.. are the soul’s projections of itself onto itself. So the being experiencing physical life is really experiencing an experience of itself that it is projecting into the awareness of itself. Why? So that it can experience “more” of itself as well as fulfill “intentions” making up the core of who and what the self is. So if you’re wanting to see proof that the soul never dies, knowing what you read is a start. Because that is the context within which your proof is going to be realized by you. You also have to be willing to be patient. The answer to your question hardly ever happens in a flash. And when it does, it is often lost. Like a dream you can barely remember in the morning. But if you’re willing to be patient, the gradual, unhurried nature of All That Is will reveal everything (anything really) you’re wanting to know. The next thing to realize is the proof is already always all around you. You just can’t see it right now. Seeing the proof requires orienting your perception so you can start seeing the evidence instead of seeing the absence of the evidence. “Orienting” your perception so you can see what you’re wanting has little to do with “doing something” and everything to do with “allowing yourself to realize” what it is you’re wanting to know. This is a very important distinction. We know we’re throwing a lot of words at you, but all this is really important to understand in realizing the answer to your question. So bear with us…. It’s easier if the person seeking this answer doesn’t use words or have beliefs that make realizing what they want harder. The word “soul” for example, leads people on a journey usually ending in belief constellations which make it hard (and often impossible) to realize what your question is reaching for. We wrote about that before here. Language is one way beliefs are communicated. You’ll notice you talk to yourself almost constantly. Much of that internal dialogue is confirming and reconfirming beliefs, many of which work against your question’s intent. So realizing how your language usually works against you and then cleaning up the language so you can begin realizing what you’re wanting is the next step. For example, look at the following two statements: I want to see evidence that the soul never diesI want to be the realizer of my eternal natureNotice statement one is very action oriented. It also presumes the evidence is not being seen (it is absent) and that the speaker wants to see it. But what this statement is doing is affirming the absence of the evidence in the way it is expressed. The perceiver wants to see something she currently does not, the “does not” component being emphasized. Notice statement two is passive. The speaker is not trying to do anything. She is expressing a desire to become something. It also affirms the existence of what it is she is wanting to realize. The perceiver understands her eternal nature is a thing and she is eager to have that realized by her. This subtle distinction is crucial to realizing the “proof” you’re asking about. Actually the word “proof” is problematic. “Proof” is adversarial. It is demanding. It is confrontational. It begs the statement that what you’re asking proof about doesn’t exist. “PROVE IT” is the energy of the word “proof”. See the subtlety? Ok, so now you have a sense of four important premises: The evidence you want will be 100 percent subjective. It will only be convincing to you. No one else.The evidence you’re wanting is all around you. You’re not trying to create the evidence or discover it. You’re wanting to realize the already-existing evidence. Or better stated: you’re wanting to realize your eternal nature, which already always has/is existed/existing.The language used in both asking and answering the question will either support your intent or defeat it.Your beliefs will hinder or help you become the realizer of the answer to your question.So now, the process is simple: you simply ask for the answer to your question in a way which supports you realizing the answer…then hold the intention that the answer is being revealed to you. What happens next is you’ll begin experiencing events confirming your intent. Things will begin happening in your life experience demonstrating that you’re eternal. But you have to keep the four points in mind and constantly question thoughts and reactions you have which will stop the evidence flow dead in its tracks. For example, one day you might be at a bus stop. Someone you know may join you at the bus stop. You’ll strike up a conversation with this person and this person may say something…mention a newspaper or magazine article, or a website, or a book, or tv show that will cause within you an “a-ha!” moment. What they say will sound so perfectly timed and so perfectly related to your intent to realize what you’re wanting. Perhaps they will mention the show God Friended Me, for example. And your mind will then do one of many different things: It may cause you to totally miss the opportunity that is the Universe and All That Is giving you a bread crumb along the path leading to your fulfilled realization. Your beliefs will prevent you from picking up on this TV show’s relevance to your question. And so you’ll just say something like “huh, interesting” and let the mention pass.Your mind may go “hmm, I remember this Quora answer I read about this and here is my friend, who I happen to meet at a bus stop telling me about some kind of TV show about god.” And your mind then might go: “this is a coincidence” and ignore the opportunity.You may feel goose pimples or a shiver down your spine and think “this is not a coincidence. This is a clue to the answer I’m wanting….” Then you’ll get excited….You then might go home later and watch the show, enjoy its premise and then, be inspired to casually research online the word serendipity….If you do something number three, then you’re on your way. What you may not realize in reading all this is, the seeming chance bus stop encounter is the beginning of the realizing of the evidence. That’s how subtle it works. Keep this up and you’ll come to experiencing all kinds of realizations. You may be invited to partake in an Ayahuasca event or a meditation sessionYou may be invited to hear someone speak about eternal naturesYou may have a dream where you experience something which adds to your realizationYou’ll begin having more and more events in your life demonstrating the reality of things science calls “pseudoscience”And then, at some point, you’ll notice your beliefs have gradually changed and you’ll begin living your life differently. As you shift your way of believing and your way of being, even more evidence will start happening: Your dreams will become more and more lucid and clearYou’ll start to want to know what your dreams are aboutYou’ll start playing with this whole idea that “you create your reality” and you’ll start getting evidence of that showing up all over your lifeThen, really amazing things will start happening that in the past you would have said “that’s coincidence” or “that’s impossible” or “random” or “confirmation bias” or some other nonsense. Only now you won’t say those things now because they happen so often there’s just too much evidence to the contrary.By then you’re on your way. The rest of the path is up to your realization. We promise, if you keep it up, you will eventually come to where every sincere person winds up: realizing, knowing they are eternal and that death is not the end.
